data.title: Department of Anesthesiology
data.meta_description: The Department of Anesthesiology, rated in the top 13th percentile of Anesthesiology programs in the country, is part of UF's College of Medicine and UF Health at Shands Hospital in Gainesville.
data.text:
All Posts

May 2023 publications

June 5, 2023

Congratulations to everyone who had publications in May of 2023! Published faculty were Doctors Doré, Fahy, Kumar, Lopez, Maybauer, Sappenfield, Schutte, Seubert, Spiess, Tighe, Vose, and Wardhan. Alzheimer’s & Dementia: The Journal of the Alzheimer’s Association O’Brien K, Feng R, Sieber F, Marcantonio ER, Tierney A, Magaziner J, Carson JL,…

Matthew Andoniadis, M.D., appointed chief of the Division of Multispecialty Anesthesiology

June 2, 2023

We are pleased to announce the appointment of Matthew Andoniadis, M.D., as the chief of the Division of Multispecialty Anesthesiology. As chief, Andoniadis will represent our largest group of physician anesthesiologists and serve as a liaison with various departments and divisions. In his new role, Andoniadis will assume a…

Leveraging artificial intelligence to improve patient safety and care quality

June 1, 2023

At the UF College of Medicine, physician-scientists are leveraging artificial intelligence to model the expansive clinician-clinician network, creating a robust patient safety graph capturing the almost infinite interactions between caregivers. Patrick Tighe, MD, MS, is the associate dean for AI application and innovation at the College of Medicine and the project champion for the AI-QI initiative under the college’s strategic plan. We sat down with Tighe to discuss these groundbreaking AI-QI programs and how they can help physicians enhance quality in health care.

Faculty Awarded Department of Anesthesiology Research Opportunity Funds

May 24, 2023

The Department of Anesthesiology’s Spring 2023 research funding opportunity, which closed on May 5, awarded five research grants totaling $18,415 to support faculty research. The winners are Michael Franklin, D.O., Amanda Frantz, M.D., Sebastian R. Gatica-Moris, M.D., Anatoly Martynyuk, Ph.D., and Soleil Schutte, M.D. Dr. Franklin’s proposal is…

Pain Medicine Fellowship Receives Grant from Abbott

May 22, 2023

We are excited to announce that Rene Przkora, M.D., Ph.D., and the Multidisciplinary Pain Medicine Fellowship program have been awarded a fellowship grant from the Abbott Medical Device Grant Committee. Abbott, which operates in more than 160 countries, produces diagnostics, medical devices and pharmaceuticals. It funds a number of…

Dr. Berkow Reelected to Faculty Senate

May 19, 2023

Lauren Berkow, M.D., FASA, professor of anesthesiology and chief of the division of neuroanesthesiology, has been reelected to the University of Florida Faculty Senate as a representative of the College of Medicine. Dr. Berkow, who has represented the College of Medicine since 2020, will begin her new term in…

April Resident of the Month: Daniel Aine, D.O.

Please help us congratulate our April 2023 Resident of the Month: Daniel Aine, D.O.! Dr. Aine was nominated by his fellow residents and faculty for consistently and selflessly supporting his colleagues. Rene Przkora, M.D., Ph.D., Appointed Lead for ASRA Pain Medicine Hot Topics Club Webinars

May 15, 2023

Rene Przkora, M.D., Ph.D., professor of anesthesiology and director of our multidisciplinary pain medicine fellowship, has once again been appointed lead for the ASRA Pain Medicine Hot Topics webinars. Since 2021, Dr. Przkora has led Hot Topics, which are a series of 60-minute, non-CME webinars.

Rohan Patel Receives 2023 J.S. Gravenstein Award

May 12, 2023

Rohan Patel, M.D., is the recipient of the 2023 JS Gravenstein Award. This award is presented each year to an outstanding University of Florida College of Medicine graduate who intends to pursue anesthesiology. Patel was selected by UF Department of Anesthesiology leadership based on his record of achievements and…

UF Department of Anesthesiology Represents North America at European Malignant Hyperthermia Group Annual Meeting

May 10, 2023

Members of the North American Malignant Hyperthermia Registry (NAMHR) traveled to Valenica, Spain last week to take part in the 41st annual meeting of the European Malignant Hyperthermia Group (EMHG). The registry has been hosted by the UF Department of Anesthesiology since 2017. The NAMHR at UF team was…

UF Health Pain Medicine Offers New Technology for Chronic Pain

May 9, 2023

UF Health Pain Medicine has recently begun offering the SPRINT® peripheral nerve stimulation, or PNS, as a drug-free, minimally invasive way to block chronic pain.

Kayser Enneking, M.D., professor of anesthesiology and orthopaedics, is a name synonymous with excellence in the field of anesthesiology. Dr. Modave envisions a future where our department can lead in building clinical informatics to support our research mission. He believes that tight…

April 18, 2023

Interns Complete 2023 Intern Education Month

February 21, 2023

Every year our anesthesiology interns go through a four-week rotation that is focused solely on didactics and simulations called Intern Education Month. The rotation also introduces the residents to available resources that can help them clinically and academically. Sprinkled throughout are wellness activities so that classmates can form closer relationships…

A new online simulator developed by the University of Florida’s Center for Safety, Simulation & Advanced Learning Technologies (CSSALT) provides a platform for learning how specific factors can impact non-invasive blood pressure measurement. UF Health Pain Medicine Offers New Minimally Invasive Procedure for Back Pain

January 4, 2023

UF Health Pain Medicine is among the first in North Central Florida to offer the Intracept® procedure — a minimally invasive, outpatient procedure that is clinically proven to relieve chronic lower back pain.

Medicine’s New Frontier

December 15, 2022

Clinicians and researchers aim to combine expertise with artificial intelligence to improve patients' lives. Patrick Tighe, MD, MS, the associate dean for AI application & innovation and an associate professor of anesthesiology, Chris Giordano, MD, an associate professor of anesthesiology, and Francois Modave, PhD, a professor of AI in the department of anesthesiology, are leaders on a team of College of Medicine faculty who are developing a comprehensive AI curriculum aimed at clinicians, students and trainees who want to learn more about ways to incorporate data and machine learning into patient care.
